title: User Experience Researcher - Remote
description:
**Healthesystems offers workplace flexibility with our Work-From-Home model, and a competitive compensation and benefits package including healthcare coverage, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k), company-provided life insurance/disability coverage, wellness options, and more.***\\*\\*Please include a link to your portfolio if possible\\*\\**


*Note: we are unable to hire in every state*


**Summary:** Supports a user-centered customer experience and product management process by championing the customer's needs within the organization. Creates and refines user insights and experiences through strategic and inventive research methodologies (through both qualitative and quantitative research and analysis) that fuel insight-driven, empathetic designs and strategies for our products. Works collaboratively with Product Managers, Product Owners, Portfolio Management, Marketing & Customer Experience, Account Management, and other key stakeholders to ensure the organization incorporates the customer as a fundamental component in product ideation, development and decision making. Ultimately, the user researcher plays a leading role in answering the triple threat questions of "Who are our users?", "What are the problems we can solve for them?" and "How can we best solve those problems?"



**Key Responsibilities: "To simplify complexities for each customer."**


* Evangelize empathy for the customer and personify the customer's voice within the organization
* Lead the creation and maintenance of organizational UX capabilities and create a 'repository' of research-based user knowledge that is insightful and informs internal stakeholders
* Participate in all steps of the product development lifecycle as a customer research expert (structure the research lifecycle, suggest research studies, educate colleagues about when to incorporate which research methods and inform on the status of what we know and don't know about the customer)
* Work in close partnership with UX Designer(s) to share valuable information and insight into user preferences, needs and problems to inform UX design strategies; translate research findings into tangible design solutions that meet our user's needs solve their challenges
* Work collaboratively with executives, the product portfolio team, product managers, product owners, marketing, account management and development teams to identify and prioritize topics for qualitative research, engaging colleagues in the research process wherever possible
* Design research studies to uncover user needs, goals, behavioral patterns, mental models, motivations, pain points and usability improvements in our applications, digital experiences and service offerings
* Conceive, plan and conduct user research projects from end-to-end; conduct thorough analysis and deliver contextual findings that are meaningful to stakeholders
* Run end-to-end ethnographic studies, concept explorations, user experience evaluations and lean usability tests including study designs; validate and maintain personas and create actionable and insightful journey maps
* Bring together qualitative and quantitative perspectives
* Conduct exploratory research to help make informed decisions on future products and business channels
* Balance high quality research with short, highly iterative cycles
* Combine user research with market research and analytics to uncover patterns and opportunities
* Deliver research results and insights in a compelling manner to influence product and design decisions
* Socialize insights and findings across the organization and with our customers to promote a shared corporate understanding and empathy for all our user groups
* Work at both strategic and tactical levels on both large-scale and small, quick guerilla-style projects
* Measure outcomes of company effort to influence customer behavior and satisfaction
* Collaborate with other stakeholders to positively impact ROI and brand satisfaction


**Leadership Responsibilities:**

Directly supervises 0 employees.



The User Researcher is the leader of user research. The User Researcher will lead internally to bring a common understanding of customer personas, needs and motivations to the entire organization. The User Researcher needs to inspire others within the organization to have empathy for our users and to play a role in instituting a systematic process of always seeking factual understanding of customer needs. The User Researcher needs to be confident and assertive regarding final decisions on user research without being un-approachable. The sole responsibility for the success or failure of the organization to understand the user resides with the User Researcher.



The User Researcher will be collaborative and act as a leader in directing the company's efforts to understand customer's needs.



The User Researcher will model and affirm shared company values and maintain mutual trust and respect. The User Researcher may provide an external consultative role to help other groups in understanding customers and users.


**Qualifications/Education/Certifications:**


* A. and/or Master's in Design Research, HCI, Human Factors, Design, Anthropology, Psychology, English and/or five years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* 3+ years conducting user experience research in a fast-paced, cross-functional product development environment


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**


* Proven ability to effectively execute various stages of the design process including:
	+ Independently plan and execute a wide variety of research studies
	+ Balance high quality research with short, highly iterative cycles
* A portfolio of past accomplishments that may include the following (but should not be limited to):
	+ User Research/Ethnographic Studies including, but not limited to data driven personas, customer experience maps, etc.
	+ Usability Findings / Design Recommendations
	+ Usability Evaluation Plan w/ Metrics
	+ Process of initiating a research project
	+ Build questions
	+ Identifying and recruiting participants for research
	+ High-level "Senior Executive" Summaries / Presentations
	+ Before/After Products with improved usability & ROI
* Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams
* A strong communicator who can cater communication style to audience needs, with the ability to influence and drive change
* Strong understanding and ability to execute a variety of qualitative research methods in a high quality way and derive insights from data and findings that have meaning to stakeholders
* Experienced in user-centered design processes and quantitative data collection and analysis
* Experience with analysis of qualitative, survey and interview data to extract what is most impactful to users, our products, and the business
* Basic understanding of quantitative methods such as A/B Testing, multivariate testing and market research a plus
* Comfortable and experienced with both exploratory and evaluative research methods and able to invent new research methods as needed
* Curiosity about how people think, feel and behave, what motivates them, and their contexts
* Experience in and/or knowledge of UX design, visual design, design thinking or user-centered design principles strongly preferred
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills and comfort with data-driven decision making
* Skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrixed organization
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills; experience with storytelling to gain interest and commitment and gain traction within the organization


**Physical Demands/Working Conditions:**



Duties are performed primarily in a home office setting utilizing computer equipment. Travel to attend meetings and visit locations throughout the country may be required. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.*\\*\\*\\* Job descriptions will be reviewed and are subject to changes of business necessity. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

title: Senior User Experience Researcher
description:
Curology is creating the next generation of skincare through customized treatment plans and formulas with powerful prescription ingredients for acne and anti-aging. We believe great skin shouldn’t be a luxury, but a fact of life.  

  

You will play a vital role in shaping our understanding of user needs so Curology can deliver a best-in-class digital experience to our current and potential customers. Responsible for leveraging user research to shape how the business understands and prioritizes the user’s experience, as well as partnering with cross functional teams to ensure a seamless experience across digital and physical products. You will help drive a consumer-driven mindset across the org by instilling an understanding of the end-to-end user experience and advocating for the consumer across the org.  

You possess a strong understanding of quantitative and qualitative user research methods, along with a background in digital and consumer products and can leverage insights to make actionable recommendations to improve the digital experience.
### **We value a diverse range of perspectives and backgrounds and are looking for a mixed methods user researcher who is:**

+ Passionate about the user (at Curology, we think of the user holistically - they are also consumers, customers, shoppers, patients)
+ An excellent communicator with high emotional intelligence and a great collaborator
+ Knowledgeable about a variety of research methods and open to learning new methods
+ Committed to high-quality and rigorous research
+ Comfortable in a fast-moving organization

### **Essential Functions and Impact Areas:**

+ Develop and own the UX Research roadmap to inform key Product initiatives, prioritizing inquiries from stakeholders or identifying areas of contextual inquiry for the business to focus on.
+ Personally initiate and conduct research across the product lifecycle to build a stronger foundational knowledge of our users. Research will consist of a mix of discovery, problem validation, foundational research, and strategic research projects.
+ Conduct generative research to identify new opportunities and add clarity to the problem space, maximizing the impact of the work of the product and design teams.
+ Demonstrate, explain, and teach others how to apply a range of research methods, understanding the balance and trade-offs between smart, scrappy research and rigor.
+ Partner with Design, Product, Engineering, Insights, and Commercial teams to build in research at multiple stages of the product development process.
+ Build on and scale the existing operation for UXR at Curology.
+ Shape or reframe the UXR and Design culture, processes, and documentation at Curology.

### **Minimum Requirements:**

+ 5+ years of user research experience, preferably with experience in a lead role or primary point of contact for a company and/or product area with many stakeholders.
+ A high level of emotional intelligence and accountability, always leading by example with empathy and humility while being willing to proactively uncover and mitigate potential biases.
+ Partnered with product, design and engineering to influence the strategy and vision that drives digital product development.
+ Experience leading and conducting generative and foundational user research and creating frameworks and experience maps.
+ Proficient in using various user research tools & testing platforms (i.e. Usertesting.com, Figma, Amplitude, etc.).
+ Led research projects from proposal to a live product, assessing vague problems, proposing high impact solutions, and executing them against a set of success criteria.
+ The ability to work independently but also collaborate cross-functionally, with the opportunity to mentor and support researchers and designers.
+ Can effectively synthesize the most important insights and communicate recommendations clearly and succinctly to all levels in the org.
+ Comfort with ambiguity and the ability to translate broad vision into an overarching research plan.
+ Experience working on both consumer goods and direct-to-consumer businesses is a plus.
+ A web link or a PDF to your portfolio is nice to have but not required.

### **Physical Characteristics of Work Environment:**

+ Remote-based work environment
+ Typing and computer usage throughout the day
+ 9-5 business hours M-F (business hours may depend on regional and local timezones)
+ Occasional travel requirements to offsite meetings

$94,000 - $150,000 a year
Our mission is simple: to make personalized skincare accessible and convenient for all. Awarded #3 for 2021 Best Workplaces in the Bay Area and 2021 Forbes #4 Best Startup Employers, Curology is a leader in direct-to-consumer eCommerce and has been featured in Vogue, Allure, Harper’s Bazaar, and Business Insider. We collaborate to achieve our goals and strive to embody our core values: Accountability, Team First & Inclusivity.

title: User Experience (UX) Researcher & Designer, Government
description:
For People is a team of skilled technologists improving government digital services for disadvantaged and vulnerable populations. We embed directly in government agencies to modernize software, systems, and platforms so that they better serve people.  

  

**Your Impact**  

As a User Experience Researcher and Designer at For People, you will play a pivotal role in the digital transformation of federal government services. You will improve key user experiences, information architecture, and page layouts to modernize a content-rich Department of Commerce website. While this role will be approximately ***80% research-oriented***, you will also utilize existing design pattern libraries to design new pages and user interfaces. This new project will transform how this particular Department of Commerce Bureau disseminates important information, enabling small businesses in the United States to grow to new markets.  

  

**Our Culture**  

For People is a team of humans. We place a significant amount of emphasis on positive work-life balance, setting healthy expectations, and making sure our loved ones are taken care of first. That means picking a child up from school during the day or going for a mid-day walk is okay!  

  

***Our entire team is remote*** across the United States, from the West Coast to the East Coast. There will never be a return-to-office, as we have none! However, it should be noted that this position will require occasional travel for on-site user research and usability testing at Government offices in Washington, DC.  

  

This position's published base salary range is between *$80,000 and $120,000* annually, plus generous benefits (e.g., For People pays 100% of Gold-tier employee health insurance premiums) and annual company profit sharing.  

  

**Your Opportunities**  

On this project, you will be on a small, agile team improving a Department of Commerce website. As the User Experience Researcher and Designer, you will:* Conduct in-depth user research to identify opportunities for improving the website's information architecture, page layouts, styling, and user flows in Drupal
* Communicate research findings and design recommendations effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Design tools to consolidate extensive content into user-friendly tools and search functions, making information easily accessible to users
* Use the US Web Design Standards, ensuring compliance and consistency in user experience
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate research findings into actionable design improvements

  

**You Bring*** A humble and caring attitude aligning with For People’s values– how we work with passion, fun, curiosity and sustainability, humility, and respect.
* 4+ years of relevant experience in user experience research, particularly for large-scale public-facing websites or services
* Experience leading user research activities for complex products and/or services, from the planning stage through the execution
* Familiarity with industry design and collaboration tools such as Figma, Mural, Dovetail (or other research repository software)
* Experience with Drupal and familiarity with the US Web Design Standards is a plus
* A strong understanding of applying human-centered design strategies, methods, and approaches
* An ability to apply design pattern libraries to design new user interfaces, with a portfolio showcasing previous work
* Strong communication and collaboration abilities

  

If you're passionate about modernizing government websites and ready to make information more easily understandable to America’s business, we encourage you to apply.  

  

Some fine print. You will be working on a United States government platform, and they have a few basic requirements for contractors like ourselves. You must perform all work physically within the United States at all times. In addition, you must be a United States citizen and be able to pass a government-performed public trust background check.  

  

For People is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, and/or veteran status.

description:
**Who We Are**
--------------


Come join First American's Digital Title Group, newly formed to re-imagine and digitize the title search and examination process through Big Data, AI, document automation and modern, cloud-native application development. As a market leading title insurance company, powered by the nation's largest and most complete property information, ownership and recorded document database, First American is committed to advancing title automation and removing friction from the real estate closing process. Our modern title decisioning solutions create certainty and speed through data and analytics, delivered to real estate agents, lenders, title agents and homebuyers. Join a team that puts its People First! Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for eight consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.

**What We Do**
--------------


We are looking for an experienced and passionate Director of Product Design and Research to act as a player-coach leading the efforts to build out the Product Design and User Research function within Sequoia. This person will be a key member of our Product Leadership team, reporting to the SVP of Product Management for First American’s Digital Title Group.

  



What You’ll Do:

 **As a Leader, you will:**

* Build and nurture a team of user researchers and designers, setting expectations, defining goals, and providing mentorship and guidance to help team members grow in their roles.
* Act as a Player Coach, investing in the professional development of the product research and design team, staying updated on industry best practices and methodologies and ensuring that team members have access to training and resources to enhance their skills.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, product researchers, and designers to ensure decisions align with user needs. Act as a bridge between UX and other functions.
* Collaborate with key stakeholders within the defined design scope to understand stakeholder priorities and ensure user research and design efforts align with the product roadmap and development cycles.
**As a Head of Research, you will:**

* Set the overall research strategy that aligns with business goals, vision, and product strategy. Determine the research activities needed to address critical questions and inform product decisions.
* Establish methodologies and frameworks for planning, executing, and analyzing user research studies, such as usability testing, user interviews, surveys, and ethnographic studies. Ensure that research methodologies are selected and executed effectively to generate actionable insights.
* Guide the analysis of research findings to distill actionable insights that inform product priorities, product design and development decisions. Translate research data into clear recommendations for product teams.
**As a Head of Design, you will:**

* Develop and implement a design strategy that outlines how the design will contribute to achieving business objectives within the defined design scope. This includes using our design principles, system, and standards to ensure product consistency and quality.
* Advocate for the importance of user-centered design principles and user research throughout the organization, promoting a user-focused culture and mindset among teams.
* Develop and evolve the Sequoia design system, style guides and component libraries.
* Quickly and iteratively create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, high fidelity mockups and detailed UI and visual design specifications to Product and Engineering teams, as well as business stakeholders and executive leadership.
 **Knowledge & Skills Required:**

* Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience.
* 4+ years hands on as a product designer
* 4+ years leading product design teams
* 4+ years leading user research teams
* Bonus if you have led blended design and user research teams.
* Previous experience developing a high-performing user design and research organization within a high growth environment
* Hands-on experience to demonstrate a deep understanding of user design theory, methods, and practices.
* Deep experience in user research, discovery, and design strategy. Fluency in best practices for web-based information architecture and interaction design, user-centered design process, as well as strong knowledge of user experience principles and techniques.
* Experience in building and maturing design operations.
  

Pay Range: $ 180,000 - $230,000 annually

  

This hiring range is a good faith and reasonable estimate of the salary range of possible compensation at the time of the posting and is subject to change. The actual compensation offered will be determined by various factors, which may include a candidate’s education, training, experience, and geographic location.

**What We Offer**
-----------------


By choice, we don’t simply accept individuality – we embrace it, we support it, and we thrive on it! Our People First Culture celebrates diversity, equity and inclusion not simply because it’s the right thing to do, but also because it’s the key to our success. We are proud to foster an authentic and inclusive workplace For All. You are free and encouraged to bring your entire, unique self to work. First American is an equal opportunity employer in every sense of the term.


Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.

We are looking for a skilled **UI/UX Artist** who is passionate about creating seamless and user-friendly interfaces for our games. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in enhancing the overall player experience by designing intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces. In this role, you will collaborate closely with game designers, artists, and engineers to take wireframes and bring them to life while improving the UX with visuals. You will be responsible for applying our current art style while also helping to push and define it.

  

**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Create visually stunning, intuitive, and responsive user interfaces for in-game menus, HUDs, character inventories, and more. Ensure a seamless and enjoyable player experience throughout the game.
* Develop interactive prototypes and wireframes to visualize and communicate design concepts effectively. Iterate and refine designs based on feedback and user testing.
* Work closely with game designers, artists, and engineers to integrate UI/UX components into the game world. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the seamless implementation of design concepts.
* Planned, conducted, and analyzed user testing sessions to validate and refine UI/UX design choices. Ensure the game's interface meets players' expectations and usability standards.
* Maintain UI/UX design consistency throughout the game, ensuring that it aligns with the game's art style, theme, and overall user experience.
* Prioritize accessibility in design, ensuring that all players, including those with disabilities, can enjoy the game without hindrance.
* Create and maintain detailed design documentation, style guides, and asset libraries for UI/UX components.
* Design and Implement medium to complex flows, screens, and components at a high-quality bar with minimal oversight.


**Requirements**
----------------


* Proven experience in UI/UX design for video games, preferably in MMOs or other online multiplayer games.
* Proficiency in design software, such as Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, or Sketch.
* Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and player psychology.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Experience with user testing and user research methods.
* Familiarity with game development tools and engines.


**Benefits**
------------


* Remote first company culture.
* Flexible work hours to support a personal work-life balance.
* Weekly remote Embodiment@Work breathing and workout exercises.
* Online language classes: English, German, French, Spanish, etc.
* Working in a multicultural environment with people from over 30 different countries.
* Flat hierarchies with an open-door policy.

title: User Research Senior Manager
description:
About Dexcom


Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2022 revenues of $2.9B, a growth of 18% over 2021. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 8,000 people worldwide.


**Meet the team:**

Dexcom is looking for an extraordinary **User Research Senior Manager** to join our growing User Research team. In this role, you will help us build new products to help people live healthier lives with our innovative glucose sensing technology. We are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity and our proud of our dedication towards creating products that empower our users to take control of their health. We build delightful, life-changing and accessible products that display data and insights across multiple platforms, and you will be joining the Dexcom at a very exciting time of growth with many new research initiatives in the pipeline.


As a User Research Senior Manager, you will be responsible for leading innovative user research that will help guide near and long-term investments for Dexcom’s industry leading line of products and services. You will leverage your research expertise to uncover insights from consumers and their health care providers to ensure we are both addressing and innovating around user needs. We are looking for a leader with a collaboration mindset that can work effectively cross functionally and, at times across geographies, to partner with Designers, Product Managers, Other Research teams, Marketing Managers, Engineers, and Data Scientists. We are also looking for someone with management experience in leading teams, developing other user researchers, and implementing best in class user research strategies across organizations.


The ideal candidate will have extensive experience leading primary user research, have a passion for advocating for the customer, and finds reward in helping to create innovative and commercially successful products and services at a global level. Our culture at Dexcom is entrepreneurial, inclusive and exciting and you will have the opportunity to work with friendly, smart people that have a great appetite for research. You will be joining a growing research team with high impact and visibility across all levels of the organization. This role reports to the Director of User Research.


This position is remote (US only) or can based in our headquarters in San Diego, CA.


**Where you come in:**

* You will define the user research strategy for a new business initiative at Dexcom, which includes identifying gaps in knowledge and devising a plan to gather and distill insights to inform product decisions.
* You will plan and conduct high quality mixed methods research with spans generative to evaluative research, leveraging both qualitative and quantitative methods. Lead the execution of all aspects of research, including defining research objectives, designing methodology, overseeing recruitment, developing discussion guides and questionnaires, programming surveys, analyzing data, putting together summative reports and socializing research across the company.
* You collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to execute UX Research, inform product and design strategy, and help improve the user experience.
* You evangelize user research throughout the organization and work in partnership with other research teams including traditional market research, human factors and customer experience to identify common themes and shapes them into actionable insights.
* You will be an advocate for the user and act as a champion for using insights to drive decision making.
* You will contribute to ongoing research process improvements, including establishing best practices and setting standards for the approach and rigor we apply to our research methods.
* You manage and mentor junior to mid-level user researchers to improve their technical research and leadership skills.
* You manage third partner vendors as needed for both recruitment and end-to-end research.

**What makes you successful:**

* 10+ years of experience in conducting end-to-end research including creating a research plan, overseeing recruiting, moderation, analysis, report writing and final presentation of results.
* 3+ years in direct managing and hiring of user researchers.
* Expertise with a broad set of user-centered research methods, including but not limited to one-on-one interviews, contextual inquiry and ethnographic field studies, surveys, A/B testing, focus groups, usability testing, concept testing, competitive assessments, diary studies, etc. Knowing when to use which method is essential.
* Confident and comfortable with mixed method research, metrics, and can synthesize and correlate quantitative and syndicated data with qualitative user research.
* Strong project management, excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills. Should feel comfortable managing multiple research projects and planning research up to 6-12 months ahead.
* Track record of collaborating across disciplines (design, product, etc) to drive change into products; must be able to work independently as well as part of a cohesive team.
* Ability to analyze complex data, distill it into meaningful insights and tell a compelling story that that inspires other into action.
* Exceptional written and oral communication skills
* Strong command of MS Office software (advanced user of PowerPoint and Excel)
* Knowledge virtual user research platforms (e.g. UserZoom, dScout, Usertesting)

**What you'll get:**

* A front row seat to life changing CGM technology. Learn about our brave #dexcomwarriors community .
* A full and comprehensive benefits program.
* Growth opportunities on a global scale.
* Access to career development through in-house learning programs and/or qualified tuition reimbursement.
* An exciting and innovative, industry-leading organization committed to our employees, customers, and the communities we serve.

**Travel Required:**

* 25 - 50%

**Experience and Education Requirements:**

* Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree with 8-12 years of industry experience
* 2-5 years of previous management or lead experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* A Master's degree or higher in Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors or a related field preferred or equivalent.
* Experience with both software and hardware product research.
* Experience in healthcare, fitness, wearables or medical device industry.
* A portfolio of research examples.
* At least 5 years in house within a product or UX design team.

**Remote Workplace:** Your location will be a home office; you are not required to live within commuting distance of your assigned Dexcom site (typically 75 miles/120km). *If you reside within commuting distance of a Dexcom site (typically 75 miles/120km) a hybrid working environment may be available. Ask about our Flex workplace option.*

Please note: The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The duties and responsibilities in this job description may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Dexcom’s AAP may be viewed upon request by contacting Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com.

title: Quantitative UX Researcher
description:
Want to be part of an amazing team, hell-bent on crafting a better future? We're always looking for creative people who care!



We are analysts. Creators. Designers. Doers. Dreamers. Explorers. Geeks. Hipsters. Leaders. Learners. Renegades. Seekers. Strategists. Visionaries. And we fundamentally believe that we're better together.



We are looking for a **Quantitative UX Researcher** to join our enterprise tech client's cloud computing (core infrastructure team, supporting Azure customer data centers and on-premises workloads. This is an opportunity to work with Azure Cloud, one of the biggest cloud services in the world, and make an impact on billions of users worldwide.


**Would you like to…**


* Explore the different datasets in Azure to uncover user behavior and business-impacting opportunities alongside fellow Quantitative UX researchers, discussing the findings with each other and surfacing best opportunities to engage with the product teams.
* Respond to specific product requests to investigate telemetry questions around product and user behavior.
* Help as appropriate with UX Research needs across projects such as running usability studies or in-depth interviews.
* Work with cross-functional teams in a corporate environment to run UX research programs from scoping to pitching to delivery to driving change.
* Dive into telemetry/instrumentation datasets to uncover patterns of behavior and connect those to gaps in the customer experience and opportunities for business impact.
* Blend quantitative and qualitative insights holistically to make the case for and to drive product improvements.
* Leverage your expertise to navigate through and across messy datasets and run clever queries to identify patterns and product-impacting insights.
* Be a compelling storyteller that makes the insights stick and help drive product change.
* Work with a small team of mixed-methods researchers and data scientists to influence product teams.


**We would like you to have…**


* 5+ years of enterprise experience as a UX mixed-methods researcher.
* 5+ years of experience working and making sense of telemetry data to inform product decisions and opportunities.
* 5+ years of experience driving, organizing, and delivering UX Research with Data Manipulation and Visualization.
* Recent experience (within the past year) in SQL and Python. Kusto Query (KQL) experience is a plus.
* Experience with Google Cloud platform, Azure Web Services, or Azure in a core cloud computing area in a technical space with the ability to quickly ramp up in the range of products that your work will support.
* Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g. Azure Synapse, Snowflake).
* Experience working in a large enterprise with experience in team work environments, data manipulation, data analysis, and data reporting.
* Confidence in communicating effectively and presenting through PowerPoint and Word.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Experimental Psychology, Cognitive Psychology, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction or a related field.
* A UX portfolio presentation to demonstrate effective communication skills, that touches on your UX Research process, as well as your experience and impact applying Big Data skills to product areas in a corporate setting, touching on kick-off, scoping, planning, executing, analysis, reporting, and driving changes with a dynamic cross-functional team.


**Would you like to work for an organization that…**


* Embraces work-life balance – our employees' well-being remains a top priority for us
* Promotes a culture of learning and advocacy across the globe - diversity will enable us to strengthen our impact
* Offers a comprehensive benefits package effective Day 1. Options include health, vision, & dental insurance, FSAs, discounts on pet insurance, PTO, paid holidays, and more
* Encourages innovation and experimentation
* Emphasizes and rewards collaboration
* Works remotely. We continue to safeguard the health of our employees so our interviewing and on-boarding process will remain virtual until further notice


**Want to know more?**



Check us out at https://www.designit.com/. Just so you know, we don't have a dress code, but we do have a strict no jerk policy. Pay range is $100k-$135k DOE.


*Designit is committed to ensuring that all candidates have an equal opportunity to be considered for employment. Please let us know if you need any reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process.*

title: Usability Researcher
description:
RedCloud is seeking a **Usability Researcher** to support immediate client operations. RedCloud Consulting is a business and IT consulting company with local Puget Sound Enterprise and Mid-sized clients. We have been recognized by Seattle Business Magazine and ranked #1 on their “Best Companies to Work for in Washington” for Mid-Sized Businesses list, awarded #1 Fastest Growing Company in Washington by Puget Sound Business Journal, and named on the Inc. 500/5000 list.  

  

**Job Description:**  

A user research specialist designs and carries out qualitative studies to understand and quantify the user experience of our clients technology products. The specialist reports actionable findings and usability metrics that product teams use to improve the product.  

  

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
* Confidently demonstrates the ability to communicate with product team stakeholders, locally and remotely.
* Forecasts, and conducts user research studies, for the designated client partner.
* Establishes deadlines associated with participant recruitment, study planning analyses, reports, presentations, and works closely with designated client partners to ensure timely and polished delivery of research results.
* Effectively assesses when a work item needs to be directly owned by a User Researcher and works closely with designated client partner to delegate otherwise trainable tasks to another clients internal team member(s), based upon competency appropriateness, available staff bandwidth, and priority.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**
* General knowledge of, and working experience with, qualitative human observational research.
* Must have participated in research projects that involved running usability studies/benchmarks; and, presenting results to critical audiences is a plus.
* Must be familiar with collecting usability metrics in a usability study including task success, Single Ease
* Must be able to work quickly and independently.
* Must have excellent interpersonal skills. The ability to communicate with, and persuade, varied audiences and argue for results (both orally and in writing) is a plus.
* A BA/BS in Psychology (cognitive, experimental, or social), HCI/HFE, or experience in Human Factors, or User Research is required.
* An MA/MS or PhD in Psychology, HCI/HFE, HCDE, or related field is preferred.

Compensation range for position is $66,600 – 130,000 DOE.  

Benefits and bonus information can be found at **https://www.redcloudconsulting.com/careers.html**  

  

  

**About Us:**  

RedCloud is a boutique, business and technology consulting firm providing local companies with expert-level support for over two decades. Anchored by a foundation of "integrity-based consulting", the RedCloud team of subject matter experts collaborate closely with clients to develop and implement high-level solutions, bringing stability, growth, and innovation together for long-term success. Visit **http://www.redcloudconsulting.com/** for more info.

title: Senior UX Designer / Researcher
description:

We seek seasoned professionals who understand technology, content modeling and possess a rich toolbox of Human-centered Design practices required for delivering successful UI/UX for web-based applications.


The successful candidate will thrive working within agile, cross-functional teams and proactively contribute subject matter expertise.

We operate within a system of transparency and open communication that accelerates progress and allows for a healthy work / life balance.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Conduct user and stakeholder interviews and research
* Create human-centered experiences and designs by understanding business requirements, the voice of the customer, user journeys, customer feedback, and usability findings

* Expertise in content modelling
* Experience with popular web content management systems such as Drupal, WordPress, Sitecore, and Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
* Ability to create interface design systems and design reusable component libraries
* Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, Agile environment
* Ability to self-manage and prioritize work
* Attention to detail
* Practical experience with Google G-Suite (or Microsoft Office)

**Nice to Have**

title: UX Research Manager
description:
**Location:**  

Remote, anywhere in the United States


**Job Description:**  

We are looking for an experienced UX researcher to join our team. This is a mid-level management position. You will be responsible for helping define and drive the future of our clients’ digital products. You will reveal who our clients’ users are and what they need from their products by conducting research, working with cross-functional teams, and performing usability studies.



Responsibilities will include:


* Collaborate with clients on the value, strategy and process for conducting user research
* Recruit and screen to find qualified survey respondents
* Gain a rich and full understanding of users through qualitative user research methods such as user interviews, surveys, and observations
* Analyze the data you’ve gathered on users to synthesize key findings to create:
	+ User research reports (for a range of qualitative and quantitative research methods)
	+ User personas
	+ User stories
* Help inform product goals by presenting your research findings to other designers, developers and marketers, both internally at Teknicks and externally to our clients


Day to Day Responsibilities & Logistics will include:

* Work closely with the Sr. Director of Client Experience & other internal team members to collaborate on client projects & tasks
* As this department grows, recruit and hire UX researchers to report into you
* Support sales team by providing insight to support their presentation and sales process
* Keep pace with UX and digital marketing trends
* Regular engagement and networking with UX experts through in-person conferences, social media networks or forums and communities online
* Contribute to operations development (recruiting future team members, process development and optimization, and tool analysis)
* Utilize Basecamp, Slack & Zoom for project management and communication


**Role Requirements**


* 2-5 years of UX research experience
* Bachelors in a human behavior related field (Google UX Design Certificate or equivalent work experience)
* Knowledge of user research techniques including stakeholder interviews, survey development and analysis, user profile development, and customer journeys.
* Ability to quickly and effectively share research results
* Ability to formulate specific, answerable, and practical questions
* Ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders and act as a strategic partner in product recommendations
* Experience with remote testing tools
* A strong desire for creative problem-solving with a positive attitude
* Excellent time-management skills
* Nice to have: experience in UX design research to guide designers on what changes to make to websites to improve the user experience & conversion rates. (Utilizing heat maps, google analytics data, A/B testing and more)


**Personality Traits & Competencies**


* Extremely organized and detail-oriented
* Self-motivated with a drive for expanding knowledge
* Strong common sense skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to work well in a team and to shine as an individual
* Ability to tactfully deliver and accept honest criticism
* Light-hearted with a good sense of humor
* Positive, easy-going personality
* Have a strong passion for human psychology and the study of people
* Enjoy stepping into the shoes of others to empathize with them and piece together a rich and deep picture of their perspectives and problems

* Competitive salary
* Health and dental insurance
* 401(k) plan with matching
* Profit Sharing
* Paid time off program

title: User Experience Analyst
description:

Specific qualifications for the UX Analyst position include:

Pay range is commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Our comprehensive benefits include


Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance


401K w/ company match


Paid time off


Professional development reimbursement

  

Wellness benefits

title: User Experience Designer
User Experience Designer
description:
### **UX Writer**

**Location:** Bangalore,India


**About Rubrik**


Rubrik is on a mission to secure the world’s data. With Zero Trust Data Security™, Rubrik helps organizations achieve business resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. Rubrik Security Cloud, powered by machine learning, secures data across enterprise, cloud, and SaaS applications. Rubrik helps organizations uphold data integrity, deliver data availability that withstands adverse conditions, continuously monitors data risks and threats, and restore businesses with their data when infrastructure is attacked.


**About Team & About Role**


The Rubrik design team is made up of product designers, visual designers, researchers, and UX writers from all walks of the industry and life. As our company and our products grow rapidly, it is crucial to scale the user experience of our product and our design team in the right way and with the right people. Every hire counts!


Our VP of Design, Oded Klimer, is seeking a UX Writer for our Bangalore, India office that will help us in our journey of creating an engaging, clear, and consumer-grade enterprise experience.

  

  

Sneak peak to our product: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UxORWF\\_7cfc


**What you'll do:**


* Curate clear, friendly, crisp and engaging messaging for our product text.
* Establish and follow standards for the Tone and Voice of our product by writing a comprehensive best practices guide that can be socialized across the product organization.
* Collaborate closely with our product designers, PMs, developers and leadership in adopting the best practices you’ve created so that Rubrik’s product messaging is clear and consistent.
* Identify areas of improvement for language in our product. Recommend, test, and validate those changes.
* Work closely with the UX research team to understand our customers and make sure their needs and abilities are taken into consideration.
* Connect product language with marketing language by ensuring that terminology is consistent and language is both clear and compelling.
* In conjunction with our technical writing team, manage our product glossary of terms, disambiguating synonymous terminology and ensuring consistent usage throughout the product.


**What you’ll bring to the team:**


* 3-4 years of relevant hands on experience in composing engaging content
* Bachelor's degree in English, Communications, Journalism, Technical Writing, or equivalent practical experience is a plus.
* Experience on user-focused product writing for complex domains.
* A portfolio of UX-focused writing samples and style guidelines.
* Experience with localization and accessibility best practices in relationship to content.
* Passion for getting things done the ‘right way’ and in a consistent manner across the product.
* Comfortability with ambiguity; you enjoy figuring out what needs to be done—and then doing it!
* Approach problems with curiosity, and excitement to learn and grow your skills
* Strong verbal, presentation, conflict resolution, and written communication skills.

**About Rubrik:**
-----------------


Rubrik is on a mission to secure the world’s data. With Zero Trust Data Security™, Rubrik helps organizations achieve business resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. Rubrik Security Cloud, powered by machine learning, secures data across enterprise, cloud, and SaaS applications. Rubrik helps organizations uphold data integrity, deliver data availability that withstands adverse conditions, continuously monitor data risks and threats, and restore businesses with their data when infrastructure is attacked.

  


**Diversity, Equity & Inclusion @ Rubrik**
------------------------------------------


At Rubrik we are committed to building and sustaining a culture where people of all backgrounds are valued, know they belong, and believe they can succeed here.

title: Engineering Lead
description:

iterations and managers V2MOM.

validated
  

research insights

(Figma)

3. Interactive Prototypes for User Testing + Research

UX Designer Responsibilities:

with cross-functional teams.

concepts and iterations. Good story teller to help communicate direction and recommendations.

title: User Experience Researcher
User Experience Researcher
description:
Senior UX Researcher - Microsoft Digital Studio


Location: Hyderabad or Bangalore, India


Overview


Are you passionate about creating user-centric digital experiences that empower people and organizations? Do you enjoy conducting both quantitative and qualitative user research and translating insights into design solutions? If so, you might be the Senior UX Researcher Microsoft Digital Studio is looking for.


Microsoft Digital Studio is a global team of designers, researchers, data scientists, and strategists who collaborate to create innovative digital products and services for Microsoft and its customers. We are looking for a Senior UX Researcher to join our Hyderabad or Bangalore studio and lead user research projects where you will be helping to drive digital innovation at enterprise scale, including exciting new spaces like AI.


#MSD  

#MSDJOBS  

#MDEE  

#MDEEJOBS  

#DPGJOBS

**Responsibilities**
--------------------


Responsibilities

* Plan, design, and conduct user research activities such as quantitative surveys, usability tests, diary studies, and interviews.
* Partner closely with key stakeholders across design, engineering, data science, and leadership to establish trust and deliver actionable insights in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Analyze and synthesize both quantitative and qualitative user data and insights to inform design decisions and strategy.
* Communicate and present research findings and recommendations to diverse stakeholders, including product teams, senior management, and external clients.
* Mentor and coach junior researchers and designers on user research methods and best practices.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and deliver user-centric digital solutions that meet user needs and business goals.

**Qualifications**
------------------


Qualifications

* An MA/MS degree or higher in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, or a related field or a BA/BS related to one of the above fields with significant academic or industry experience.
* At least 5 years of experience in conducting user research for digital products and services, preferably in an agency or consultancy setting.
* Proficiency in a variety of user research methods and tools, such as qualitative and quantitative analysis, remote and in-person testing, prototyping, and data visualization.
* Experience with online survey platforms, such as Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, or Microsoft Forms.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and quality.
* A portfolio of user research projects that demonstrate your impact and process.
* Experience working across employee experience tools is a big plus!

 **Location:** We are hiring in the following locations: Bangalore or Hyderabad, India.

title: User Experience Researcher
description:
Our Company
  
  

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
  
  

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
  
  

The opportunity
  
On the Design Research & Strategy team, our mission is to lay a user-centered foundation for Adobe product design and development. We are seeking a Senior Experience Researcher to steer research for Adobe Illustrator, from early explorations through shipping new features/products.
  
What we do
  
  

Assess project scope, form appropriate research questions, and identify appropriate research methods (developing new methods if/where needed)
  
  

Runs research studies from start to finish, including developing a realistic research plan and materials, recruiting participants, and synthesizing data into actionable insights.
  
  

Build alliances across the company to identify new partners, drive teamwork, and deeply understand the business context of research problems. We engage with different roles and product teams to understand and influence business goals, system architecture, and product designs.
  
  

Identify new strategic opportunities and initiatives that the product and organization can explore.
  
  

Advocate for the customer by articulating research findings and product ideas through clear and insightful presentations. We often present work in group-wide or company-wide forums (e.g., brown bags, tech summit, MAX, KTB, etc.).
  
  

Mentor junior staff and supervise contractors/vendors on more complicated programs of study.
  
Who we are looking for
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Significant hands-on research experience, with at least 5 years of that experience in an industry setting (e.g. UX/product research, market research, consulting, etc.)
  
  

Able to handle areas (user/product/domain) that may be ambiguous or ill-defined.
  
  

Experience conducting research on new, emerging technologies (e.g. Generative AI).
  
  

A deep understanding of the product life cycle and conducts research in a timely manner to have maximum impact.
  
  

Experience with ethnographic research.
  
  

Strong organizational, planning, and time management skills.
  
  

Can collaborate well across all project roles (design, research, product management, engineering, etc.)
  
  

Goes beyond summarizing study data to identify significant user needs and/or product issues.
  
  

Is comfortable connecting the dots between mixed data types (qualitative, quantitative, analytics) to create deeper and more comprehensive insight narratives.
  
  

Can proactively identify and communicate clear product solutions based on these findings, sometimes across departments.
  
  

Presentations connect to broader business goals and KPIs.
  
  

Experience communicating work at the management, director, and VP levels.
  
  

An undergraduate degree from a 4-year, accredited institution.
  
  

**Nice to haves:**  

Experience researching creative workflows, including desktop apps, mobile apps, and web-based tools.
  
  

Knowledge of graphic design user workflows, pain points, needs, and motivations.
  
  

Interest and experience with GenAI technology & understanding how people want to leverage GenAI
  
  

An advanced degree in HCI or HCDE, or similar field.
  
  

Familiarity with or interest in Adobe’s creative (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator).
  
  

Experience with survey development, including building, executing, analyzing.
  
Why you’ll love working here
  
  

Collaborate with and learn from other researchers from a wide range of backgrounds; Psychology, Anthropology, HCI, Computer Science, Design and Management, Linguistics, Consulting, Market Research, and more.
  
  

At Adobe, we value the differences in others’ stories and ideas— You’ll be able to bring your authentic self to work every day.
  
  

We offer a competitive benefits package including; unlimited vacation days, 401k matching, educational reimbursement, wellness dollars, fertility benefits, parental leave, childcare assistance, gender reassignment benefits, and more!
  
  

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. Adobe is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to help you succeed. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
  
About Adobe Design
  
Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers, content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud.
  
  

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.
  
  

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.
  
  

Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

description:

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**The Company**
===============


Hi there!


We are Almabase - a bootstrapped, profitable B2B SaaS company with a mission to make education affordable for everyone. We’re doing this by enabling institutions to raise more funds from their alumni. The idea started from our founders’ struggle with the lack of scholarships when they were students. Watch this TEDx talk from Kalyan to learn more.


Our customers are usually staff in educational institutions' alumni relations/advancement offices. The value prop for them at a high level is simple - “Engage more alumni and raise more money from them.” About 90% of our customers are from the US, but starting in 2024, we’re also expanding our market to the UK and Canada. Our team is based in India and the USA. The Indian team is based in Bangalore, and the US team is fully remote.

**The Opportunity**
===================


The PDEQ team at Almabase is a roughly 20-member team across product, design, engineering, and quality.


You will be joining the team at a time when we need to continue innovating on some of our best-selling products while building the for our next wave of customers.

**As a Senior Product Designer,** you will need to conduct user research, explore design solutions collaboratively, validate assumptions systematically and work with our engineering and design teams to ship best-in-class products within budget.

**Location & Timings**
======================

* Our customers are primarily in the US. So any research and feedback calls that you need to conduct will happen between 4 PM and 2 AM IST.
* We rely heavily on documentation to reduce the number of meetings and collaborate effectively. So there is a lot of flexibility around your work internally within the product team.
* The PDEQ team works out of our office in Bangalore. Our work processes allow anybody to work remotely for stretched periods when they need to, but in general, everybody is in the office 2 days a week.

**Key Responsibilities**
========================

* Almabase is on a mission to build world-class web experiences for the fundraising and advancement industry globally. You will play a critical role in building interfaces for some of the top schools and universities in the world.
* You will manage a team of 2-3 designers that work across different products and objectives while taking charge of some of our most critical user journeys.
* Conduct user research and distill insights for Almabase’s most innovative products. These are uncommon user journeys where we rely directly on our user research to design experiences.
* You will set up and run processes that make it easier for the design team to discover and fix quality issues across the vast scope of the Almabase product ecosystem.
* You will work with Product managers to maintain a pipeline of user experience improvements for our customers and the business.

**Our Ideal Candidate**
=======================

* You have over 3 years of work experience as a UX researcher/Designer in a software company. Preferably a B2B Product that has multiple users from different teams.
* You have built user experiences from the ground up on 0-1 products and have worked on usability feedback on established products.
* You can structure problems clearly for yourself and communicate solutions in a simple manner for others.
* You have a disciplined approach to design. Relying on design principles and research.
* Experience with building and maintaining design systems.
* You spend a lot of time on the small details.
* You have the ability to lead a team. Brownie points if you have hands on experience of managing a team.
* You are a hands-on, experimental, and continuous learner.
* You are open to getting on video call meetings with our customers in the US at 12 - 2am IST

**What to expect within the first year**
========================================

**Within the first month**

* Get to know the various problems we are solving for different people in the advancement office.
* Get to know how we are solving those problems. Learn about the products we offer and how it solves a pain for our customers.
* Get to know the team you are working with. Schedule a 1-1 chat with as many members of the Almabase team across all functions to learn about how we work.
* You will take design work right from your first week - to help you get an idea about the current processes within the product design team at Almabase.
* You have your first monthly 1:1 with your manager to identify priorities for ramp up.

**Within 3 months**

* Multiple features you worked on have been released to production by now. You have your first quarterly review with your manager.
* You are positioned as the designer for our most complicated user journeys - Integrations and Data pipeline. You have had multiple conversations with our customers and have worked on numerous large and small fixes for their problems.
* You have monthly 1:1s with designers who report to you to learn about their challenges and how you can help them grow.
* You are now sharing critical feedback with your reporters and the rest of the team.
* You are now actively involved in making design decisions for other projects and products as well.

**Within 6 months**

* You have a plan about improving the design system and improving our processes of incorporating usability feedback.
* You have setup a few new processes at Almabase to monitor and improve the interface quality across all products at Almabase.
* You run the weekly Designer’s meeting that includes designers across all teams.

**Within 12 months**

* You will take on larger mandates from the product team because you understand the customer’s pain points and the market really well.
* You will work with your manager on identifying new areas of growth for you and the team.
* Identify key objectives and performance indicators for the design team next year.

**Benefits**
============

**This is what our team members enjoy the most at Almabase:**

* **Strong Culture:** We have a culture that we’re proud of. Read more on how our team feels about the company on Glassdoor (here). When you work at Almabase, you get to work with amazing people who will help you grow to become the best version of yourself.
* **Unlimited leaves & flexible work hours:** That wasn’t a typo. There is no ceiling to the leaves or restraint to your working hours. Our only policy is that you use your good judgment.
* **Transparency & Trust:** An environment that trusts each individual’s ability and creativity to achieve the best outcome for the team. High levels of transparency help you get exposure to what’s happening across the business.
* **Great Salary & Equity:** Our top performers and leaders get stock options along with competitive salaries. As Almabase grows, you’ll have a real opportunity to create wealth for yourself and your family.
* **More than work:** One big secret to our success (shhh… this is just between us) is finding the balance between work and play. We have plenty of activities throughout the year that help build esprit de corps – whether they are intense cricket/football/basketball matches or fun-filled music/dance/trivia/game nights.
* **Food & Snacks:** You’ll never have to worry about your hunger pangs. We provide tasty home-cooked food & snacks at all times of the day.
* **Health insurance:** We offer health insurance for you and your dependents.
* **Mental Health is a Priority:** Unlimited therapy sessions and mental health support to help you feel better, get better, and stay better.
* **The comfort of home:** On a tiring day, if you want to take a break in bed or if you want to jog & take a shower at work, or play your heart out on PS4, you can do it all at Almabase.


If you’ve made it this far, then maybe you’re interested in joining us for something truly wonderful. Get in touch with us, or apply now!

title: User Experience Designer
description:
**We help the world run better**


Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.Apply now!

**What you’ll do:**


As a UX Designer, you will work on creating simple, usable, and consistent designs across solutions. Our multi-disciplinary team includes researchers, UX and visual designers, and design evangelists.


In your day-to-day, you will:

* Own and drive the design problems from ideation to execution.
* Analyze customer behaviors, identify opportunities to solve problems, and create cohesive, best-in-class experiences to our most challenging and high impact areas.
* Work closely with Product Management, Engineering, and more experienced designers at a strategic level to frame what should be built and how to get there.
* Create user scenarios, user journey, wireframes, UI designs and prototypes throughout the full cycle of the product development.
* Participate in every facet of the product development process: product ideation, usability research, rapid prototyping, visual design, as well as coding and content integration.
* Help translate business product goals and requirements into cutting-edge design concepts.
* Help create and review UX effort estimations for new projects with unclear scope, ambiguity, or high complexity.
* Work with Design Infrastructure team to leverage the latest design system and contribute to its continuous innovation.

**What you bring:**

* Minimum 4+ years of experience in UX and Product Design
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Interaction Design, Product Design, User Experience Design or other related fields.
* You should be proficient in industry-standard design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch, Mural, etc.
* You have a portfolio that displays a spectrum of creative design solutions and excellent understanding of fundamental design principles & information architecture.
* You have professional experience with a strong UX and interaction design background, as well as a track record of shipping high quality products.
* You have outstanding collaboration and stakeholder management skills that enable you to successfully drive projects and topics on a global scale.
* Ability to articulate rationale of design and research decision making in a clear and logical manner via conversations or presentations.
* Experience with prototyping to explore and convey design solutions.
* Fluency in both written and spoken English.

**Meet your team:**


SAP Business Network is a cloud-based collaboration offering that can help you transform disconnected supply chains into unified, collaborative, and intelligent networks that remove barriers and centralize data. With a unified network, you can connect to all trading partners through a single directory, collaborate using shared data and workflows, and apply network-wide intelligence to guide decisions to adapt and improve your business. SAP Business Network’s vision is to enable every organization and every industry to become a network of intelligent, sustainable enterprises.

  

#UXT2

**We build breakthroughs together**


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

title: Senior User Experience Designer
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: **Bangalore, Karnataka, India; Hyderabad, Telangana, India**.### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 8 years of experience in product design or UX.
* Experience designing across multiple platforms, and working with technical/design teams to create user flows, wireframes, and building user interface mockups and prototypes.
* Portfolio highlighting multiple projects and your direct contributions.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience designing technical enterprise-class applications.
* Experience prototyping your own designs using Figma.
* Experience working collaboratively with and influencing other designers, product managers, and engineers across geographies.
* Ability to lead products from scratch and improve features within a user-centered design process.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate positions, and advocate designs.

**About the job**
-----------------


At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.  

  

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.  

  

As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.



Looker is a unified platform that powers data experiences and delivers actionable business insights to employees at the point of decision. Looker integrates data into the daily workflows of users to allow organizations to extract value from data at web-scale.

--------------------

* Design product experiences from concept to completion.
* Create user journeys, mockups, prototypes, storyboards, and presentations to communicate ideas and help your team try them out before they build them.
* Build relationships and influence with stakeholders.
* Promote UX design efforts, mindset, and methods through presentation and communication. Advocate design processes, principles, and tools to peers.
* Work with and influence User Researchers, Product Managers, Engineers and others in the Cloud product area to create a positive user experience for specific enterprise and customer use cases to help drive impact across multiple compute engine focus areas.
