title: User Interface Designer
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience in product design or user experience (UX).
* Portfolio highlighting multiple projects and your direct contributions.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* 2 years of experience as a product designer working with design systems.
* Experience contributing to mature design systems including component design, documentation, and education.
* Knowledge of Figma design tools.
* Knowledge of technical constraints and best practices in designing for digital platforms and responsive web, as well as inclusive design principles.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and creative problem-solving skills.

**About the job**
-----------------


At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.  

  

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.  

  

As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.



Database performance management is a part of our goal to provide more observability tools (also called monitoring tools) within products. The mission for Insights is to empower users to quickly understand, troubleshoot, and optimize their databases with an easy to use experience.

  

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements, and provide creative solutions.
* Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, or high fidelity prototypes.
* Integrate user feedback and business requirements into ongoing product experience updates.
* Advocate for the prioritization of design centered changes, refinements, and improvements.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: User Experience Manager
description:
Bangalore, India
Category
 Design
Posted Date
 02/21/2024
Job Id
 347195
  
We’re looking for a **UX Lead** to join our Bangalore team building industry-leading applications for connected lighting. Signify’s digital portfolio includes IoT applications that leverage data generated by millions of light points in cities, offices, and other professional installations. Customers use our software to manage their lighting system and gain valuable insights into space utilization, environmental factors, energy optimization, and more.

  

Working as a **UX** **Lead** at Signify is dynamic. You’ll play an active role in a world-class design team that is at the heart of a brand’s strategy, be an essential part of a dynamic structure that sits within the corporate Innovation team of Signify and whose mission is to deliver meaningful insights and value to the business by leveraging the power of a strong in-house design function. We’re greater together through peer learning in our globally diverse team, with different backgrounds and nationalities.


The Signify Design Team is a diverse team with a global footprint and wide-ranging areas of expertise. Its responsibilities include supporting a variety of business groups, advocating design practices, leading change, sparking collaboration, understanding users, building competence, and elevating the standards for design in our industry. We work closely with product managers, engineers, and researchers to deliver cohesive digital services and products. A love for people, design and an eye for detail is in our DNA.

  

You will work closely with our internal partners to translate customer, business, and technology demands into innovative digital offerings that set the standard for the lighting industry. In addition to organizing the local team, you will be hands-on conducting user research, exploration, ideation, and crafting detailed UX/UI designs. Someone equally inspiring and pragmatic.

  

Your challenge is to build a strong UX competence in Bangalore that is closely integrated with a global UX team adhering to Signify’s high quality standards and methods. Our UX designers are embedded into product teams where they work fluently with Signify contributors, stakeholders, and engineers in India, Europe, and the US.

 **What** **you’ll****do**

* Lead, coach, and manage projects for a local team of designers contributing across professional business segments
* Design the UX/UI for global, industry-leading applications on native- and web-based platforms
* Collaborate and build relationships with key stakeholders in the Design organization and beyond
* Represent and deploy our user-centric design practices within product teams across the company
* Partner with business and R&D functions to refine methods and ensure design quality at all stages of the development process
 **What** **you****’ll** **need**

* **Bachelor’s/****Master’s Degree** in an UX/UI design-related field
* **Minimum of 15** **years**of relevant user-centered design experience in software development
* Ability to demonstrate your past work and process via a strong design portfolio
* Relevant experience in the management of designers with mixed competencies
* Advanced-level use of Figma and Agile development tools and methods
* Up-to-date knowledge of the latest web and mobile design trends, frameworks, and best practices
* An active attitude in discussing and setting trends and opinion in your field of work: you are a thought leader, or about to become one

**What you’ll get in return…**


We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.


See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

**Who we are**


Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.


We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.

title: Designer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


**Job Title:**
Sr.UX Designer
**Location:**
Hyderabad, India
**Schedule:**
Full-Time, Permanent
**Team:**
Design & User Experience
**Department:**
Design & User Experience
**What's your new role about?**
-------------------------------


DAZN is a world-first OTT streaming service for live sport. DAZN customers watch major events in football, boxing, basketball, tennis and more, in over 200 countries and territories.  

  

We're shaking up the industry by giving customers access to their favourite sports anytime anywhere, on any device. And we’re constantly striving to do more, to build the best product possible – with even more sporting rights, more original content, and more innovative features. Enthusiasm and excitement for our game-changing mission is what unites us across the business.  

  

Our Product Experience team is structured according to the various stages of the customer journey. As a UX Designer within this team, your role would be focused on engagement and loyalty – specifically, split 50/50 across advertising and betting.  

Sport, advertising and betting go hand in hand, and DAZN is perfectly positioned to continue its trend for disruption in this space. You'll have a great understanding and appreciation of both the betting and advertising ecosystems. With a data-driven approach, you'll work closely with advertising and betting teams across product and engineering to build truly engaging and unique experiences that create value for different audiences.  

You'll be designing exceptional experiences on mobile, web and TV platforms that are valuable, easy to use, and of the highest level of craft and execution. You’ll use your entire range of product design, interaction design and visual design skills, and you’ll own experiences across multiple platforms and devices. **Your team**
You’ll be a key designer in our friendly, driven and fun Product Experience Design team. We believe in building solid relationships and surpassing expectations. We directly impact product strategy and how we shape new experiences as we work together towards becoming the no 1 global sport destination.  

  

### **As our new UX Designer, you'll have the opportunity to:**


* Design user-centred experiences for DAZN's cross-platform products
* Create forward-thinking designs by owning the complete design process from the definition to launch for all our platforms
* Deliver creative solutions for our business objectives
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams across Design, Product, and Engineering to support the company vision and objectives
* Mentor more junior members of the team
* Work with Engineering to ensure high-quality design implementation and user experience
* Work with UX Researchers to interpret the results to ensure the end-product design provides users with the optimum experience
* Present your designs to peers and stakeholders, helping the Product Design team articulate and rationalise capabilities against customer insights and business goals

### **You'll be set up for success if you have:**


* Experience in Product Design, UX, UI, or related fields and a versatile portfolio that showcases deep interaction and problem-solving skills across all platforms (e.g. iOS, Android, Web, TV)
* A good understanding of the challenges of building global products and being sympathetic to their specific needs and cultural differences
* Ability to work with Product and Engineering teams, negotiating priorities and technology constraints to ensure products are delivered on schedule
* Excellent communication skills to articulate your concepts and drive alignment with your cross-functional stakeholders
* Willingness to collaborate across the team and take on board key feedback to work back into your design and thinking
* Experience working in fast-paced environments.
* An appreciation and understanding of A/B testing process and comfort using data to inform design decisions
* An earnest, mature, and ego-free attitude that welcomes candid feedback
* A willingness to fail and learn
* Experience contributing to and consuming component-based design systems

### **Even better if you have:**


* Experience designing for TV devices with an understanding of distinct design constraints and nuances
* A real passion for design and the enthusiasm to constantly look at ways to improve collaboration across Product and Engineering
* The ability to work alongside our UX Research and experimentation teams to make intelligent informed decisions from customer behaviours
* A self-starting attitude with motivation to take ownership of initiatives, seeking out problems to solve

### **Here's a little more about us…**


At DAZN, we bring ambition to life. We are innovators, game-changers and pioneers. So, if you want to push boundaries and make an impact, DAZN is the place to be.  

As part of our team,you'll have the opportunity to make your mark and the power to make change happen. We're doing things no-one has done before, giving fans and customers access to sport anytime, anywhere. We're using world-class technology to transform sports and revolutionise the industry and we're not going to stop.
**DAZN VALUES – THE ‘HOW’ IN WHAT WE DO:**
**AMBITIOUS – people who want to make a big impact and drive DAZN forward.**
**INVENTIVE – people with bright ideas who deliver great new experiences for our customers – and improvements for our business. People who come up with better, simpler ways of doing things.**
**PASSIONATE – people who are proud of our product, our content and our business – and love to shout about it. People who love what they do and show commitment every day.**
**BRAVE – people who take difficult decisions to help us focus on improving DAZN, our performance and our results.**
**SUPPORTIVE – people who know that we achieve more as a team than as individuals. People value inclusion and look out for each other, helping their colleagues enjoy their work and develop their careers. People who consider others before making decisions.**  

At DAZN, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment that values equality and diversity, where everyone can contribute and have their voices heard. This means hiring and developing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, age groups, sexual orientations, gender identities and abilities.  

Everyone has the opportunity to make change and impact our DEI journey by joining our ERGs: Proud@DAZN, Women@DAZN, Disability@DAZN and ParentZone.

If you’d like to include a cover letter with your application, please feel free to. Please do not feel you need to apply with a photo or disclose any other information that is not related to your professional experience.

Our aim is to make our hiring processes as accessible for everyone as possible, including providing adjustments for interviews where we can.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Digital Consultant
description:
**UX Design Sr. Consultant**
----------------------------

**About the role**

**Are you** **someone who's looking to solve problems that matter?** **Do you enjoy crafting experiences and optimizing products for effective and enjoyable use across various digital platforms? Then we have the right fit for you!**

At Deloitte Digital, we pride ourselves on our keen understanding of what our users want and expect. Our multidisciplinary team of Strategists, UX Designers, Visual Designers, researchers, engineers, architects, and product managers works together to ensure that we’re creating a better future for our clients. Our studios are a living breathing example of our work ethic and culture which is built on dependability, accountability and transparency. We’re looking for bright minds and personalities to join our digital studios across India.

### **The work you will do?**


As a design consultant you will be working very closely with the cross functional team to come up with design solutions for the problem at hand. Your key responsibilities will include but not limited to:

* Conduct discovery workshops and brainstorming sessions with client and other stakeholders to uncover insights and actionable design execution plan using design thinking & innovation techniques.
* Identify and frame problems effectively from high level business requirements, translate users pain points and research findings into impactful design solutions.
* Lead key modules on client engagements and bring forth user centred design advocacy while explaining your concepts to all stakeholders.
* Proactively engage with multiple project stakeholders, including product managers, engineers, and other designers in by drafting and brainstorming initial concepts.


* Possess an in-depth understanding of the fundamentals of visual design and apply frameworks like atomic design to set up design libraries to streamline your work.


* Mentor your peer designers by providing insightful reviews on deliverables and ensure design quality.


* Stay curious about the new developments in design and technology and lead initiatives to share your experiences with the studio community via various platforms.


**What you will need?**

* At least 6 years of hands on experience working on digital products, additional perks if you have worked on B2B products.

* Well-versed in using design and prototyping tools (Sketch, Figma, inVISION, Principle, Adobe Suite) to create top notch products and deliverables.

We have done some amazing award winning work. **Check it out!**

**Culture at our studios**

Studios are a melting pot where people from different capabilities come together to create a difference. We are focused on building a ‘maker culture’ with a bias towards experimentation. A culture centred around innovation where our teams feel empowered to take risks, break all rules and embrace failure.


We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centred, confident, and aware. We continue to focus on creating a great workplace for everyone; a place where everyone is encouraged to bring their best selves to work.


**Learn more about Life at Deloitte studios**

From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte recruiters.

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

Our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. title: Senior User Experience Designer
description:
ValGenesis now seeks to reinforce its lead position by upping our product’s user experience. To support this, we are seeking a Senior UX Designer to join our global team of UI/UX designers, researchers, and developers.


This position encompasses all the elements of UX design with a special emphasis on creating a functional design system, which also includes drawing on user research. Our design team ideates solutions, structures information hierarchies, and lays out concepts. This also includes creating UI mockups and prototypes and polishing the aesthetics of the UI. All this is done across rapid iterations in response to user testing.


The Senior UX Designer will be responsible for playing a vital role in driving the UI/UX initiatives and collaborating with the UX research, product, and engineering teams, and report to the Senior Director of UX.

**Responsibilities**

**Design**

* Translate business and technical processes into wireframes, mockups, icons, and images that lead to intuitive user experiences on mobile, web, and IoT platforms.
* Play a vital and leading role in creating the functional Design System for our entire product ecosystem.
* Apply platform UX style requirements such as material design, iOS Human Interface Guidelines, etc., and document and maintain UX style standards.
* Design and produce visual assets such as icons, illustrations, and photos as required.
* Reinforce the brand through a visual language that includes color, type, layout, and motion.
* Collaborate with UI developers to deliver interactive products as good or better than their mockups.
* Deliver aesthetics, power, and usability in one package.

  



**Management**

* Estimate UX design effort.
* Set targets and track progress against them.
* Mentor the design team.
* Coordinate deliverables with product and senior management.
* Review designs and provide constructive feedback.
* Coordinate the evolution of the ValGenesis Design Language System.

  



**Innovation**

* Ideate and innovate with product management and UX research teams during design sprints and whiteboarding sessions.
* Create innovative design solutions that delight users and accomplish business objectives within engineering and budget constraints.

**Information Architecture**

* Design information hierarchies and structures that align with user models, convey information scent and facilitate information retrieval and understanding.

**Process**

* Rapidly iterate designs based on user feedback and testing.

**Requirements**

**Design Skills**

* Understand and apply UX heuristics and best practices.
* Understand and apply principles of contrast, repetition, alignment, and proximity in UI design.
* Understand and balance requirements for usefulness, ease of use, aesthetics, discoverability, findability, learnability, and efficiency within a single product.

**Tooling**

* Effective with pencil and paper or whiteboard design.
* Effective with tools like Figma, Adobe XD, UXPin, Miro, etc.
* Ability to produce UX assets with tools like Figma etc.
* Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React.js/Native an asset.

**People & Work Skills**

* High fluency in English language skills.
* Strong listening skills.
* Ability to work and collaborate cross-functionally in a fully remote setting.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent projects and deliver on deadline.
  

**Experience**

* 8 or more years of professional UX design experience, with two or more as a lead.
* Experience with agile teams is an asset.
* Experience with frontend development an asset.
  

**Education**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a UX-related area such as BFA/MFA, design, or HCI.
* UX-specific coursework or certification is preferred but not required.

**We’re on a Mission**


In 2005, we disrupted the life sciences industry by introducing the world’s first digital validation lifecycle management system. ValGenesis VLMS® revolutionized compliance-based corporate validation activities and has remained the industry standard.


Today, we continue to push the boundaries of innovation ― enhancing and expanding our portfolio beyond validation with an end-to-end digital transformation platform. We combine our purpose-built systems with world-class consulting services to help every facet of GxP meet evolving regulations and quality expectations.

**The Team You’ll Join**

* Our customers’ success is our success. We keep the customer experience centered in our decisions, from product to marketing to sales to services to support. Life sciences companies exist to improve humanity’s quality of life, and we honor that mission.
* We work together. We communicate openly, support each other without reservation, and never hesitate to wear multiple hats to get the job done.
* We think big. Innovation is the heart of ValGenesis. That spirit drives product development as well as personal growth. We never stop aiming upward.
* We’re in it to win it. We’re on a path to becoming the number one intelligent validation platform in the market, and we won’t settle for anything less than being a market leader.

**How We Work**


Our Chennai and Bangalore offices are onsite, 5 days per week. We believe that in-person interaction and collaboration fosters creativity, and a sense of community, and is critical to our future success as a company.


ValGenesis is an equal opportunity employer that makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Our goal is to have the best-qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by local law.

title: User Experience Researcher
description:
**Senior UX Researcher**
========================

**Are you in looking for an opportunity to work with a diverse team in an international organization?**

**Do you enjoy being part of a successful team?**

**Join our talented UX Research Centre of Excellence**


We’re a passionate team that outlines the vision and standard in how we perform UX Research across the organization. We also help the design team craft experiences that create value for our IET customers by partnering with Product and Engineering teams.

**Partner with the best**


As a Senior UX Researcher you will bridge the gap between our customers and the business to execute on multiple projects as an individual contributor across multiple technology domains.


As a Senior UX Researcher, you will be responsible for:

* Involving in UX research throughout the Product lifecycle, working horizontally with multiple product teams
* Being champion UX Research and the use of Users insights from both qualitative and quantitative research to put the customer at the heart of the product design process.
* Collaborating with Design & Product teams to clearly define research objectives and approach with consideration of the business goals, customer needs, and technical feasibility.
* Planning and delivering high-quality qualitative and quantitative research, ensuring the appropriate methodology is used and research objectives are met.
* Guiding product teams on using our customer learnings and the personas you’ll create.
* Promoting the UX Research Centre of Excellence and all things research related across the organisation.
* Working effectively and collaboratively with senior researchers, stakeholders, and subject matter experts

**Fuel your passion**


To be successful in this role you will:

* Have Masters or Degree in a relevant discipline such as **Human Computer Interaction, Psychology, UX Design, Digital Design or Information Architecture** etc.
* Have an expert-level knowledge in the field of **UX research with up to 5+ years’ experience applying UX research on digital products**
* Have a practical experience with qualitative and quantitative research methodologies such as: semi-structured interviews, usability testing, facilitating workshops, contextual enquiry, co-design, ethnographic research, creation of personas, journey mapping, surveys etc
* Have an ability to use a range of standard UX research software & tools.
* Have a knowledge of design principles, UX design experience, and/or service design
* Have an experience working in an agile product development environment and applying lean UX research methods
* Have an experience working in a multi-disciplinary team and the ability to work well with a variety of people who come from different departments, disciplines, and cultural backgrounds.

**Work in a way that works for you**


We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

* Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

**Working for you**


Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:

* Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
* Comprehensive private medical care options
* Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
* Tailored financial programs
* Additional elected or voluntary benefits

**About Us:**
We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.  

**Join Us:**
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.  

  

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Product Designer
description:
**Lead Product Designer**
=========================

**Job Description Summary**
---------------------------


Do you thrive in a startup vibe? Were you built for a small, nimble and dynamic team that's ready to win? If you answered yes, we want to talk to you! We are now going back to our roots as a standalone business unit to focus on our SaaS business—an area where we see growth potential. This business unit is unique, and we certainly aren’t afraid to stand out from the crowd and tackle the bigger competitors.

  

As a Lead Product Designer, you’ll work with Product and Engineering teams to ensure ShareFile’s customers can manage their content and collaborate with their clients efficiently from any device. You will also play a pivotal role in setting up design culture as we look to realize double digit growth on $200M+ revenue in a fast-growing market.

**Role Overview**
-----------------


Now, let’s get to the details. This role will have ownership of end-to-end design delivery as a part of the product development process and will work closely with user researchers, product designers, and cross functional team members to deliver high quality design solutions with strategic intention. This includes:

* **Work independently and effectively in a fast-paced environment**


	+ Organize and lead large, complex projects with ease and confidence, including initial project planning, managing timelines, and communicating project status
	+ Create wireframes, concepts, prototypes, and high-fidelity visual designs to effectively communicate design solutions across the entire release
	+ Lead and/or partner with user research to validate assumptions and inform design decisions

* **Communicate design work within the user experience team and with cross-functional teams**


	+ Present designs in a clear, confident, and concise manner to diverse audiences, incorporating data, user insights, competitive analysis, concept designs, and business knowledge to rationalize and drive ideas for improvements or new features
	+ Explain rationale for design decisions within a larger context
	+ Frequently seek diverse feedback, receive and weigh with a growth mindset, and integrate as appropriate

* **Collaborate within the user experience team and with cross-functional teams**


	+ Collaborate closely with research and contribute to research strategy
	+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product management, engineering, and others to ensure design solutions meet business and user needs

* **Provide solutions with strategic intention**


	+ Develop a deep understanding of business practices and rationale
	+ Identify opportunities for research in your product area and work with user research and/or UX leadership to prioritize and plan
	+ Seek opportunities to push our product experiences by introducing predictive and future-focused concepts that elevate what exists today
	+ Proactively identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues as they arise

* **Demonstrate subject matter expertise in user-centered design**


	+ Advocate for the role of research and design throughout the product development process
	+ Effectively advocate for the user when working with partners across functional areas; Provide coaching and mentorship on how to apply design thinking and human-centered design principles
	+ Offer guidance and mentorship to more junior designers
	+ Stay up-to-date with design trends and best practices and incorporates new techniques into work

**Your Superhero Uniform Includes**
-----------------------------------

* 8+ years of user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design, including experience in:


	+ User-centered design methods and techniques (e.g., user research and testing, data analysis, customer journey maps, etc.)
	+ Designing for software applications for multiple platforms (e.g., web, mobile, desktop)
	+ Working and collaborating in Agile development environments using management and issue tracking software (e.g., Jira)
* Bachelor's degree in visual design, interaction design, human factors, human-computer interaction, or equivalent professional experience
* A solid portfolio showcasing product design experience and process
* Proficiency in creating low- to high-fidelity wireframes, design concepts, and prototypes using industry tools such as Figma and Adobe CreativeCloud
* Strong understanding of design thinking, user-centered design, problem solving, and design systems
* Passion for design, users, and collaboration with designers and cross-functional team members

**Your Superhero Strengths Include**
------------------------------------

* Working knowledge of web technologies and frameworks (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React); experience with front-end coding a plus

**About Us:**


Citrix and TIBCO recently merged to create Cloud Software Group, now one of the world’s largest cloud solution providers, serving more than 100 million users around the globe. When you join Cloud Software Group, you are making a difference for real people, each of whom count on our suite of cloud-based products to get work done — from anywhere. Members of our team will tell you that we value diverse lived experiences, passion for technology, and the courage to take risks. Everyone is empowered to learn, dream, and build the future of work. We are on the brink of another Cambrian leap - a moment of immense evolution and growth. And we need your expertise and experience to do it. Now is the perfect time to move your skills to the cloud.

description:

ensuring concepts and designs are consistent with the overall branding strategy and marketing initiatives

Leads the design process through sessions with customers, showcasing the proposed design while engaging
  

stakeholders
  

Consistently advocates for the user’s interests while balancing professionalism with real world project
  

constraints
  

Collaborates with customer, design and development teams during Design phases and subsequent
  

development support cycles. Guides and mentors team members and external parties such as, for example,
  

design studios
  

Provides and signs off on creative estimations and ensures high quality execution of all deliverables
  

For UX: Performs functional analysis and design of specific application behaviors (business flows, application
  

flows, screen layouts, logical and physical data model, etc.)
  

Prepares wireframes and/application flows. Reviews the flows with key stakeholders, makes adjustments

**Design thinking facilitator s**

  



Facilitators must embrace user-centered-design methods and mindset, lead with curiosity, and are a fast-moving innovation research and design division of Ameriprise. Have the ability to design, plan and facilitate dynamic and effective workshops, research projects, and alignment sessions. You'll need to format and right-size the sessions to reach goals, utilize Design Thinking methodologies and mindsets, and create a constructive, safe space to tap collective intelligence and creativity. Sessions may include leadership and team alignment, design sprints, journey mapping discovery work, needs assessments, prototype testing and more.

  

Who you are:

* Empathetic and lead with curiosity
* Have a trove of workshop tools you're comfortable using including Design thinking practices, bonus for using any Liberating Structures
* Adaptable and able to adjust to differing groups
* Confident, independent and a quick study
* Available for engagement in short- or medium-term projects
* Understanding of the Financial Advice sector

* Collaborate with UX Researchers, Designers, Business Architects, Data Analytics Teams, Product Stakeholders & Managers, Developers and more importantly Leaders to identify opportunities that will benefit from user centered design approach or UX offerings.

* Facilitate complex engagements/ work sessions/ sprints for key decision-makers and cross-functional teams to solve problems using Design Thinking and more.

* Rapidly bring ideas to life through a variety of means, from hand-drawn storyboards to functioning prototypes and beautifully designed artefacts with digital prototyping tools (eg. Adobe Creative Suite, Figma).
* Present ideas, including rationale based on customer research and best practices, to the product development team and other key stakeholders.

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required.
* 10+ years of broad experience of conducting hands on UX Research - Qualitative & Quantitative, including Usability studies, Interviews, Contextual Inquiries, Surveys, Card Sorts etc.
* Proficient knowledge of user-centered design process, UX best-practices and relevant disciplines, including information architecture, interaction, and visual design.

title: User Experience Researcher
description:
At Azure, we’re building a culture based on learning. We want to know what our customers want and what’s going to make their work and lives better. True innovation comes from a deep understanding of our customers' needs and aspirations. As one of the fastest-growing and highest-impact technologies in the world, Azure is at the forefront of shaping the future.
The Azure Cloud Experiences Studio is seeking a motivated and creative UX researcher who’s passionate about understanding customers, analyzing data, and excited to know about cloud computing. As a part of a multidisciplinary team, you’ll be working on delivering the next generation of experiences for Microsoft Azure. You will have opportunities to leverage a broad array of qualitative and quantitative research methods. As your product team creates new features, you’ll help them make decisions based on data and user perspectives. You bring your skills to your fellow collaborators with optimism, curiosity, and an open mind. We are working toward the vision of Azure as the World’s Computer, and we need your help.
In our team, we believe in the power of inclusion, diversity of ideas, work/life balance, and the joy of solving challenging problems. We help large enterprises use Azure however and wherever they need it - in the cloud or on the edge - all at a huge scale. We strive for a collaborative culture where everyone can flourish and innovate, including in our own approaches to the ever-changing global climate and flexible work. Join us, and you’ll be a part of a passionate community of UX professionals, working on one of the most exciting and fastest growing products in the world.
Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* You will collect and analyze UX data for a feature area, then share accessible insights that improve design and engineering processes for that feature area.
* You will collaborate in cross-disciplinary research efforts. This will involve mentoring other disciplines, providing research tools, recruiting programs for research, and helping put together large-scale customer learning events.
* You will leverage a wide range of research methodologies including usability studies, interviews, surveys, scorecards, competitive benchmarks, clickstream analytics, A/B testing, ethnographic field research, participatory designs, and user modeling.
* You will innovate on new methods and practices that contribute to the UX community within Azure and Microsoft.
* You will work in an agile development process and juggle multiple deliverables.
* You’ll need to be detail-oriented and thorough in your approach to research methodology, but flexible enough to work within time and product constraints.
* You will need to be a passionate advocate for our users throughout the development process and demonstrate how this leads to business value.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field
* 2+ years of experience conducting user research in tech companies with a proven record of having an impact on products.
* Experience with a broad range of research methodologies (usability studies, interviews, site visits, surveys, user modeling, card sorting, or related methods).
* A presentation of work demonstrating experience delivering UX research that results in product improvements and business impact.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master's or Doctorate Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field AND 3+ years User Experience Research experience
* 2+ years of experience within the technology sector and experience in research methods impacting both product direction and detailed experience design.
* Coordinating work on multiple products/releases
* Ability to work within tight timelines and with excellent project management skills
* Technical knowledge of cloud computing, IT, and computer programming
* Excellent oral and written communication skills with an ability to effectively communicate rich customer data and articulate the implications of research findings.

**Additional Details:**


Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

title: User Experience Researcher
description:

They ensure that experiences meet user needs in an engaging way through discovery and validation research via a variety of methodologies. The Researcher will be responsible for partnering with designers, product owners, content and UX strategists to balance user, stakeholder, business and technology needs and transform UI designs into highly effective and usable solutions.**Responsibilities**

* Contribute in Design Projects by collaborating with UX Researchers, Designers, Business Architects, Data Analytics Teams, Product Stakeholders & Managers, Developers and more importantly Leaders to identify opportunities that will benefit from your research offerings.

* Help identify and define Quantitative research protocols for product(s)

* ﻿﻿Study raw research data/insights/raw findings, reporting findings through written reports and presentations to help draw conclusions to drive informed decision making, and track the impacts it has on our products in a continued manner/ongoing basis.

* Work with UX designers, engineering teams, and product managers to ensure research findings are fully leveraged in the product design and development life cycle.

**Practices**

* Experience working with tools such as Google Analytics, Glassbox, Adobe Analytics

title: Lead Designer
description:
Join us as we work to create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
The Opportunity:
Join athenahealth’s quest to make healthcare work the way it should. Our health is incredibly precious, and people in need of health care are often at their most fragile. Yet the function and experience of healthcare continues to fall far behind the innovative services we receive in other more frivolous parts of our lives.
athenahealth is looking for designers who can dive into complex design challenges and create solutions to help transform the healthcare industry. If you’re a talented, innovative, and strategic designer, motivated to make a difference in healthcare, then we want to talk to you. Help us break through all the red tape and transform everyone’s experience of a visit to the doctor, a trip to the emergency room, or a lifetime with a chronic illness.
Position Summary:
We’re looking for a Lead Designer to thoughtfully contribute to our award[1]winning electronic health record and physician practice management products.
In this role, you will work closely with a multi- disciplinary agile R&D team to define, design and test product and digital service features with the goal of creating valuable and delightful experiences for our users. At the same time, you will set an example and establish best practices for more junior design colleagues. A successful candidate will embrace the challenge of elevating design within an enterprise product team, where user experience competes for attention against many other valid R&D priorities.
The Team:
Our Data Platform zone within Platform Services subdivision liberates the wealth of healthcare data across our ecosystem, seamlessly transferring and transforming bulk data so clients can easily move to, grow with, and operate on athena, and harness the power of our network insights. While you will individually own the experience design for the products your team works on, you will be supported by a horizontal UX org and researchers working on various products and projects. This will unlock potential opportunities for mentoring as well as learning, ensuring a high-growth environment for you.
Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Design execution (primary)* Identify and frame user-centered problems effectively
* Plan and facilitate problem identification and solutioning workshops
* Create low- to high-fidelity sketches to communicate concepts and ideas
* Collaborate with product and engineering teams throughout the agile planning, design and development process to deliver released product that meets design intent
* Collaborate with your team to ensure product features meet UX quality standards for workflow, interaction design and microcopy Design Strategy and planning
* Build deep understanding of healthcare workflows by planning and executing user, client, and domain research.
* Co-own business goals for the scrum team with partners in the Product and Engineering organizations.
* Partner with product & engineering leads help define how initiative strategy impacts your scrum team and its projects.
* Draft UX workflows that can guide detailed Agile design and development.
* Ensure design work is conducted using behavioral data focused on user[1]centered product success metrics.
* Facilitate product and engineering teams in building deep empathy for our users Leadership
* Demonstrate and promote best practices for working with product owners and scrum teams
* Participate in team-wide initiatives to improve design processes and practices
* Guide junior members of the team through mentorship and design reviews


Education, Experience, & Skills Required:* A degree in User Experience, Interaction Design, HCI or similar, or a degree in a different field with impressive experience that negates formal design qualifications
* Minimum of 7 years of experience in UX design
* Solid capability in UX creative and design techniques
* Experience facilitating, summarizing and acting on take-aways from user research
* Understand how to work within agile development process for the design, development, and delivery of software
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills


Behaviors & Abilities Required:* Skillful at influencing colleagues and project direction without direct authority
* Capable of managing ambiguity, change and uncertainty, focusing on information at hand and making good and timely decisions to effectively keep work moving forward
* Takes appropriate risks through cost/benefit analysis of various alternatives
* Adaptable to ever-changing needs of a dynamic business with flexibility and willingness to jump into any aspect of work to help the team achieve results
* Enthusiasm for learning new problem spaces, with an ability to deeply immerse in a problem, rapidly develop an understanding, and produce actionable insights.
* Thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment


About athenahealth
Our Vision:
To create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
Our Location:
This role will be based in Chennai, India. Our Global Headquarters is located in Watertown, MA, just a few miles from Boston. We have two other India locations in Bengaluru and Pune.
Our Culture:
At athenahealth, our employees (or “athenistas”) are committed to making healthcare smarter. Our success is dependent on the diversity, collective spirit, and contributions of our people, clients and partners. We value teamwork and believe that the strength of our team comes from supporting each other and leveraging our specialized skills. If you are looking for company that will enable you to work outside of your comfort zone to transform the healthcare ecosystem, athenahealth is the place for you.
Our Perks:
Along with health & financial benefits, our athenistas are offered a variety of perks that promote employee wellbeing such as commuter support, collaborative workspaces and dog-friendly offices - just to name a few.
About athenahealth
Here’s our vision: To create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
What’s unique about our locations?  

From an historic, 19th century arsenal to a converted, landmark power plant, all of athenahealth’s offices were carefully chosen to represent our innovative spirit and promote the most positive and productive work environment for our teams. Our 10 offices across the United States and India — plus numerous remote employees — all work to modernize the healthcare experience, together.  

  

Our company culture might be our best feature.  

We don't take ourselves too seriously. But our work? That’s another story. athenahealth develops and implements products and services that support US healthcare: It’s our chance to create healthier futures for ourselves, for our family and friends, for everyone.  

Our vibrant and talented employees — or athenistas, as we call ourselves — spark the innovation and passion needed to accomplish our goal. We continue to expand our workforce with amazing people who bring diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives at every level, and foster an environment where every athenista feels comfortable bringing their best selves to work.  

Our size makes a difference, too: We are small enough that your individual contributions will stand out — but large enough to grow your career with our resources and established business stability.  

  

Giving back is integral to our culture. Our athenaGives platform strives to support food security, expand access to high-quality healthcare for all, and support STEM education to develop providers and technologists who will provide access to high-quality healthcare for all in the future. As part of the evolution of athenahealth’s Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program, we’ve selected nonprofit partners that align with our purpose and let us foster long-term partnerships for charitable giving, employee volunteerism, insight sharing, collaboration, and cross-team engagement.  

What can we do for you?  

Along with health and financial benefits, athenistas enjoy perks specific to each location, including commuter support, employee assistance programs, tuition assistance, employee resource groups, and collaborative workspaces — some offices even welcome dogs.  

In addition to our traditional benefits and perks, we sponsor events throughout the year, including book clubs, external speakers, and hackathons. And we provide athenistas with a company culture based on learning, the support of an engaged team, and an inclusive environment where all employees are valued.  

We also encourage a better work-life balance for athenistas with our flexibility. While we know in-office collaboration is critical to our vision, we recognize that not all work needs to be done within an office environment, full-time. With consistent communication and digital collaboration tools, athenahealth enables employees to find a balance that feels fulfilling and productive for each individual situation.

title: Senior User Experience Designer
description:
Introduction  

Thomas J. Watson said it best: “Good design is good business.” Visualization is critical to discovering data-driven insights and effectively communicating that knowledge to others. Designers at IBM work to create experiences that work together, work the same, and work for our clients. Does the thought of creating the platform at the heart of solutions like Watson, Blockchain, IoT, and Security excite you? If so, read on!  

  

Your Role and Responsibilities  

IBM’s clients are some of the world’s leading companies and you will be part of a large-scale enterprise challenging projects to build and support technical solutions for their needs. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!  

IBM Automation is seeking an experienced User Experience Designer in Kochi with a proven record of delivering irresistible solutions which address our customers’ most challenging business problems and opportunities. The best candidate will have experience collaborating effectively with a cross functional team in agile and lean delivery methodologies. The candidate must demonstrate leadership, technical curiosity and tenacity to partner with some of the leading technologists in the field of cloud and cognitive computing to design products that are modern and user-friendly.  

As a user experience designer in IBM Automation, you will:* Deliver, review and critique the UX Designs of a multi-skilled design team to ensure effective and rich designs (great interaction, supreme visual styling, consistent and appropriate use of voice and tone, etc)
* Work with UX Designers, visual designers, researchers and product managers to understand user’s needs and behaviours for the industries in which they work
* Participate in and lead lean UX activities (in person and remote) in an Agile environment such as user/design research, interviews and workshops
* Analyze and synthesize the findings; distilling the inherent complexity in the user’s experiences and identify the right problems to solve
* Translate findings into usable, useful, effective and efficient user experiences
* Clearly and quickly deliver ideas to cross-functional teams
* Provide information verbally and visually through low and mid-fidelity renderings (starting with paper and pencil/whiteboard) and clickable prototypes
* Test and validate working hypothesis with users through usability testing of wireframes, clickable prototypes and published product, and participate in design critique
* Work with Visual Designers and Developers to bring concepts to life while maintaining UX best practices
* Work on quality assurance to address any issues.

  

Required Technical and Professional Expertise  

* Experience in user experience design role and performing the design activities to deliver successful outcomes for software, web, or mobile delivery.
* Strong portfolio of work demonstrating Design Thinking, design process, and solutions for web and mobile applications.
* Ability to take rough technical information and make it understandable and well presented.
* Ability to clearly communicate a design through storytelling that helps the audience develop empathy for the user, and clarity on what the user experience of the software will be.
* Ability to create designs at a variety of fidelity levels and understanding of the most appropriate techniques to gather the most useful feedback at different stages in the process.
* Experience designing and delivering for accessibility
* Experience of software tools for design, production, and implementation, such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Cloud applications.
* You will be required to work on-site in the Kochi office with the ability to work remotely occasionally

  

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise  

* Experience working with enterprise software
* Data visualization skills
* Experience of HTML and CSS is also beneficial.

description:

Thomas J. Watson said it best: “Good design is good business.” Visualization is critical to discovering data-driven insights and effectively communicating that knowledge to others. Designers at IBM work to create experiences that work together, work the same, and work for our clients. Does the thought of creating the platform at the heart of solutions like Watson, Blockchain, IoT, and Security excite you? If so, read on!  

  

Your Role and Responsibilities  

Advisory User Experience Researcher - Sustainability software.
  

IBM Sustainability Software is responsible for creating software products that help our customers optimize operations and cost, while reducing waste and emissions. We are looking for our next experienced user researcher to help our Envizi product team deliver delightful, end-to-end experiences informed by user needs. Envizi helps enterprises simplify the capture, consolidation, management, analysis and reporting of their environmental, social and governance (ESG) data.  

  

As an advisory UX researcher on the Envizi team, you will have the opportunity to shape our UX research strategy, mentor a team of researchers, and demonstrate impact and influence on the product roadmap. Rigor, attention to detail, insatiable curiosity, comfort with ambiguity, and a willingness to learn will be critical to your success.  

  

You will be expected to contribute as a key research leader in your geography and with the broader Sustainability Software Research group, which spans the globe and works on half a dozen software products. Within our research community, you will collaborate on projects as needed, provide UX research craft expertise and mentoring to earlier career researchers, and contribute to organizational projects.  

  

Responsibilities:  

Strategic Product Leadership: Develop and execute a comprehensive UX research strategy that aligns with business goals, ensuring a user-centered approach throughout the product development lifecycle. Define the research roadmap that you and your user research team will execute.
  

Practice Leadership: Mentor UX researchers, providing guidance and feedback, and fostering their professional growth. Help drive best practices for research methods, leading by example, and contribute to the creation of repeatable processes that enable a user research organization to grow and scale.
  

Research Planning: Define research goals, methodologies, and timelines for various projects, ensuring alignment with product objectives and user needs.  

User Research: Conduct qualitative and quantitative research studies, such as interviews, surveys, competitive analyses, prioritization exercises, concept testing, contextual inquiry, and user journey mapping to gather insights about user behaviors, needs, and preferences. Design Thinking workshop facilitation skills are also beneficial.  

Data Analysis: Analyze research data and derive actionable insights that drive informed design decisions and product improvements.
  

Stakeholder Collaboration + Influence: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including executive and “pre-executive” level designers, product managers, and engineers, to advocate for user needs and ensure research findings are effectively communicated and integrated into the product development process.  

User Advocacy: Serve as a user advocate, ensuring that user feedback and insights are consistently considered and prioritized in product decisions.  

Industry Trends: Stay up to date with the latest UX research methodologies, industry trends, and best practices, and proactively apply them to enhance our research processes and deliverables.  

Research Operations: Establish and optimize research operations, including participant recruitment, research tools, and documentation, to streamline research activities and ensure high-quality deliverables.  

Collaboration and Communication: Foster a collaborative and inclusive research culture, encouraging knowledge sharing and effective communication across teams and stakeholders.  

Executive eminence: Measure and present the impact that UX research has produced through your leadership and work.
  

  

Required Technical and Professional Expertise  

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, User Experience Research, Anthropology, or a related field.
* Proven experience (5+ years) conducting user research throughout the entire product development lifecycle.
* Strong leadership skills, with experience leading / mentoring other UX researchers and proven experience contributing to the growth of a research practice.
* Expertise in both qualitative and quantitative research methods (as noted above).
* Proficiency in data collection and analysis, and the ability to triangulate customer insights from a combination of data sources to derive meaningful insights.
* Solid understanding of UX principles, design thinking, and human-centered design processes.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to leverage storytelling to effectively convey complex research findings and recommendations to diverse stakeholders. Emphasis on executive-level communication.
* Demonstrated experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams and driving UX research initiatives within an agile product development environment.
* Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities, with a keen eye for detail.
* Passion for user-centered design, empathy for users, and a commitment to delivering exceptional user experiences

  

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise  

* None

title: User Experience Researcher
description:
Job Brief:  

* Collaborating with UX designers and product managers to understand research needs and work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders to provide experience insights
* Understand and analyse user needs and problems through a range of qualitative and quantitative methods, including interviews, and usability tests.

title: User Experience Designer
description:
**Date:** Feb 29, 2024


**Location:** Pune, IN


**Company:** Springer Nature Group  



**About Springer Nature Group**


Springer Nature opens the doors to discovery for researchers, educators, clinicians and other professionals. Every day, around the globe, our imprints, books, journals, platforms and technology solutions reach millions of people. For over 180 years our brands and imprints have been a trusted source of knowledge to these communities and today, more than ever, we see it as our responsibility to ensure that fundamental knowledge can be found, verified, understood and used by our communities – enabling them to improve outcomes, make progress, and benefit the generations that follow. Visit group.springernature.com and follow @SpringerNature / @SpringerNatureGroup


**About Springer Nature Group**

  


Springer Nature opens the doors to discovery for researchers, educators, clinicians and other professionals. Every day, around the globe, our imprints, books, journals, platforms and technology solutions reach millions of people. For over 175 years our brands and imprints have been a trusted source of knowledge to these communities and today, more than ever, we see it as our responsibility to ensure that fundamental knowledge can be found, verified, understood and used by our communities – enabling them to improve outcomes, make progress, and benefit the generations that follow.

  


**About Us**


Data & Analytics Solutions (DAS) - is the databases and shared services division of Springer Nature used by researchers, scientists and students around the globe. The global community spans Beijing, Berlin, Dordrecht, Heidelberg, Lisbon, London, Madrid, New York, Pune and more. We work in collaborative, multi-disciplinary delivery teams, developing digital products and services that aim to exceed user expectations and anticipate their needs.


The work is interesting and meaningful.  

Our culture is collaborative and friendly.  

We encourage and support growth, both personal and professional.


This is a terrific opportunity for friendly, inquisitive people who want to get involved in our work, who love to learn, who will embrace and develop our culture, and help make DAS a place where people and ideas can thrive.


We are intentionally looking to create teams that are diverse and inclusive. Diversity is the mix of culture, background, experience and personality that we all bring; inclusion is getting the mix to work better together. We want every member of our teams to contribute to our common goals while respecting each other's skills, knowledge and needs.


**About the Role**

  


We're looking for a user experience designer who can help our Materials Solutions team design tools and services for the Materials Science community.


Materials Solutions flagship product, SpringerMaterials, focuses on improving Materials scientists experience working in energy & solar cell applications. SpringerMaterials provides a resource to effectively find trustworthy materials and properties information that precisely matches their context. So that they can efficiently design new, or improve on existing, materials to solve complex global challenges.


The job is based in our Pune hub, with team members also in London (UK), Heidelberg and Berlin (Germany), Beijing (China) and New York (USA). We offer hybrid working - from the office 3 days per week. You'll be part of our bigger community of UX practitioners and DAS community located in the various global locations listed above.

  


**Responsibilities**


Supported by the UX Lead, UX Researcher and UI Designer, you will:


* Recognise and articulate end-user problems, pain points, challenges and opportunities within the materials science domain.
* Facilitate the creation of well thought through, low-fidelity diagrams that explore ideas and solutions across user flows and customer journeys.
* Develop concepts from wireframes through to mid-fidelity mockups as well as interactive prototypes and present solutions to the team while taking on feedback and iteration based on insights.
* Organize, plan, and conduct research activities.
* Create a culture of sharing findings within the project, programme, and design teams.


**What you'll be doing**


You will be a champion for the customer, creating experiences that align with Materials Solutions vision and deliver user-centered design solutions.


**Within 3 months**


Get settled:


* Learn about the Springer Nature group, our DAS group and the various domains.
* Understand the Materials domain, meet stakeholders and grasp the background and context of various projects.
* Begin to work with the DAS UX Lead and get to know your design peers/community.
* Research - Familiarise yourself with what has been done till date, gathering the context and history of it.
* Design - Familiarise yourself with the existing process and make contributions where possible.

  




**Within 6 months**


Be involved:


* Research - Begin to work with the UX Researcher, to plan and conduct continuous discovery.
* Design - Delivery, prioritization, reviews and critique.
* Collaborating regularly with the UX Lead, UX Researcher, UI Designer, members of the Materials Solutions team, design peers and wider community.
* Take the lead on UX Design within your team, provide design direction.
* Actively participate in the UX community.

  




**6 months +**


Make an impact:


* Research - know where there are gaps and assumptions. You know the relative risk and potential effort of each that is clearly laid out in a plan for the foreseeable future.
* Design - is informed by research and the design system, any new elements and insights are fed back into the design system.
* Be involved in strategy planning sessions that help shape the product and its direction, by being the voice of, and expert on the user, through your design and research work.
* Be proactive within your team, with the wider UX community and beyond.

  




**About You**


* You have an appropriate number of years of UX Design experience in a mid-level capacity with at least 1 year of experience working on a task heavy related application.
* You have a design portfolio (website or PDF) demonstrating critical thinking, analysis and sound decision-making as well as diverse UX methods and techniques.
* You enjoy getting involved with every stage of the UX lifecycle.
* You have experience working with stakeholders and non-designers and have an empathetic, articulate and open communication style.
* You like working in a collaborative (remote and in-person) team, where there is collective ownership of the product.
* You know your strengths and recognise opportunities to learn and improve.

  




Having a good command of English is important; collaboration is important in our day to day work, so being able to communicate your ideas and understand others’ is key.


For all roles in all locations, we offer a competitive, industry-benchmarked salary.


To find out more about the package provided at each location, please visit https://careers.springernature.com/

  


#LI-SG2



At Springer Nature, we value the diversity of our teams and work to build an inclusive culture, where people are treated fairly and can bring their differences to work and thrive. We empower our colleagues and value their diverse perspectives as we strive to attract, nurture and develop the very best talent. Springer Nature was awarded Diversity Team of the Year at the 2022 British Diversity Awards. ttps://group.springernature.com/gp/group/taking-responsibility/diversity-equity-inclusion


If you have any access needs related to disability, neurodivergence or a chronic condition, please contact us so we can make all necessary accommodation.


For more information about career opportunities in Springer Nature please visit https://careers.springernature.com/

title: User Interface Designer
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience
* 4 years of experience in product design or User Experience (UX)
* Portfolio highlighting multiple projects and your direct contributions

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Advanced degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Interaction, or equivalent practical experience
* Experience using design and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma, Figjam)
* Experience designing technical applications
* Experience working collaboratively with other designers (e.g., UX researchers, UX writers, product managers, and engineers)
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate positions and advocate designs

**About the job**
-----------------


Google Cloud Platform (GCP) provides cloud infrastructure that powers Google to people and organizations, and helps them accelerate digital transformation. As part of the Core Infrastructure of GCP, Storage User Experience team, you will help customers store, manage, and move data securely with ease of use. You will help the team envision how people experience Google Cloud Platform based enterprise solutions and build through crafts and collaboration.


In this role as a UX Interaction Designer, you’ll take on tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible, and easy-to-use designs. You will collaborate with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers, and Product Managers throughout the design process.  

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

--------------------

* Understand Google Cloud Platform products, technologies, user motivations, market opportunities, and competition.

* Work in all stages of the product life-cycle from an idea to concept, build, and post-launch.
* Work with Researchers, Product Managers, and Engineers in a changing environment.
* Communicate design ideas, rationalize and justify decisions, and advocate for users’ needs.

title: Design Manager
description:
**PRINCIPAL DESIGN MANAGER**


If you thrive in understanding complex scenarios in order to build creative and relevant design and interaction patterns and you are interested in defining the next generation of thoughtful administrator tools for businesses, this job could be your next challenge!


Microsoft SharePoint and OneDrive team is looking for an exceptional Principal Design Manager with a proven track record for deep understanding of the technical concepts at play and the ability to make complex simple. You will have the opportunity to provide principal-level project leadership and exemplary work in brand-new product areas. You will lead and partner with distributed teams across the company, to establish the next level of administrative experiences for Microsoft.  

  

You’ll have the opportunity to make product decisions, construct UX solutions, and participate in defining the vision of the end-to-end user experience. The ideal candidate will be an end-user advocate, driving user needs and goals into both intuitive and pragmatic design solutions, as well as understand and be enthusiastic about modern web development. You will be experienced in the application of user-centered philosophies and interaction design best practices. You will be able to distill evolving design work into patterns and capture those in articulate and insightful guidance for others to use as a creative springboard.


You’re passionate about content and knowledge, and a committed advocate for the end user. You love working across disciplines and collaborating with other teams to bring about the best outcome.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

**Responsibilities****:**
